column3: B. Download files / connect to server
column4: C. Run locally / upload to ghidra
column5: D. Look for common bug classes / indicators of flag
column6: E. Understand how user input -> vulnerability
column17: Architecture and OS support locally running
column18: Architecture and OS support uploading to decompiler
column19: Tool / system does not support approach
column25: Debug strings for errors, logs, etc. exist
column28: Ability to run the program (emulation, local, etc.)
column29: Ability to use debugger/debug program to get meaningful information (control flow, register context)
column31: Malware techniques by attacker (in offensive context)
column32: Discovery of defensive mitigations (ASLR, Data execution prevention, stack canaries)
column34: Issue between local and remote context
column35: Confirm sufficient number of primitives available
column36: Primitive discovery tools are available (grep, ropper)
column38: Architecture makes discovery of primitives difficult
column41: Discover switching architecture during program execution
column45: Assume dynamic variables are static (+ vice versa)
column46: Wrong versions of binaries given to you
column47: Discover only have ability to leak certain number of characters
column48: File headers are incorrect/misleading, leading to poor assumptions + distraction
column49: Misleading information from binary, e.g. polyglots (distraction)
column52: Primitive discovery tools are tricked or do not work
